official_title: A bill to amend title 5 of the United States Code to extend from two days to four days the number of days per thirty calendar days during which crews of vessels may be granted leaves of absence and to remove the restriction that such leaves of absence be applicable only to service on extended voyages.

summary.text: Increases the number of days of leave which may be granted to an officer, crewmember, or other Federal employee serving aboard an oceangoing vessel. Eliminates the restriction that such leave is only applicable to service on an extended voyage.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 5 of the United States Code to extend from two days to four days the number of days per thirty calendar days during which crews of vessels may be granted leaves of absence and to remove the restriction that such leaves of absence be applicable only to service on extended voyages.
